alert.note: Alert for Brown; Callahan; Coleman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 10:59PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Callahan, Brown and northeastern Coleman Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1059 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cisco to near Burkett. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Cross Plains, Blanket, Putnam, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Atwell, Cross Cut, Lake Brownwood, Zephyr, Byrds, Rowden, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Camp Bowie, Echo, I-20 Near The Callahan-Eastland County Line and Owens. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 316 and 323. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
